content: Cheese. Geraldine had never heard music before. Noises, yes. Many noises. The voices of people, the slamming of doors, the barking of dogs, the rushing of water, the meows of cats in the courtyard. And of course the soft peeping of mice. But music, never. Then one morning in the pantry of the empty house where Geraldine lived, she discovered an enormous piece of Parmesan cheese, the largest she had ever seen. Eagerly, she took a little bite from it. It was delicious. But how would she be able to take it to her secret hideout in the barn?

content: For a moment, Geraldine stood deep in thought. Then she took a step backwards, solemnly lifted the tip of her tail to her puckered lips, took a deep breath and blew. She blew hard. One of the melodies of the cheese flute echoed in the air. The little mice held their breath in amazement.
